column17: Plot:"Russell and his younger brother Rodney live in the economically-depressed Rust Belt
column18: and have always dreamed of escaping and finding better lives. But when a cruel twist of fate lands Russell in prison
column19: his brother becomes involved with one of the most violent and ruthless crime rings in the Northeast - a mistake that will cost him everything. Once released
column20: Russell must choose between his own freedom
column21: or risk it all to seek justice for his brother."

column16: Plot:"Smart-but-ineffectual journalist Dan \"We use euphemisms!\" cannot decide between his girlfriend
column18: or his lover cold-but-intellectual photographer Anna; herself indecisive between Dan and honest-but-thuggish \"You're bloody gorgeous!\" doctor Larry. The film
column20: puts the four leading characters in a box and strips them apart."
column24: Awards:"Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 21 wins & 33 nominations."

column11: Writer:"Bart De Pauw (based upon the film written by)
column17: Plot:"The architect Vincent Stevens; the psychiatrist Chris Vanowen; the real estate agents Luke Seacord and Marty Landry; and Chris' half-brother Philip Trauner are married and best friends. Vincent proposes his friends to share a wonderful penthouse loft in a brand new building designed by him to become their rendezvous instead of using their credit cards for love affairs and one night stands in hotels. When they discover the body of a beautiful woman cuffed on the bed in the loft
column18: they have argument to find who is the responsible and secrets are disclosed affecting their friendship."
